TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XamlDirective extends System.Xaml.XamlMember

Docs.summary: Provides the XAML type system identifier for a member if the member is also a XAML directive. XAML readers and XAML writers use the XamlDirective identifier during processing of member nodes. The identifier is used when the XAML reader is positioned on a and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsDirective%2A> is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks XamlDirective provides expected values for the XAML type system when the member is a XAML directive. By definition, a XAML directive has characteristics that always return the same results for a subset of the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> properties, and the same XAML type system information is reported for all possible XAML directives. The reporting of XAML type system characteristics that are specific to directives is accomplished by internal behavior or through overrides of <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> `Lookup*` virtual members in the XamlDirective class.
The following list shows the returned results of a XAML directive for <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> when the member is actually a XamlDirective:
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.LookupCustomAttributeProvider%2A> is always `null`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.DeferringLoader%2A> is always `null`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.DependsOn%2A> is always `null`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsAmbient%2A> is always `false`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsAttachable%2A> is always `false`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsDirective%2A> is always `true`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsEvent%2A> is always `false`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsReadOnly%2A> is always `false`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsReadPublic%2A> is always `true`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsWritePublic%2A> is always `true`.
Also, the internal backing for <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.DeclaringType%2A> remains unset and returns `null`.
> [!IMPORTANT] > XamlDirective is a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> subclass. As with <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember>, XamlDirective has security considerations regarding how the XAML type system reports access. See Remarks in <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember>.

MemberSignature.Value: public XamlDirective (string xamlNamespace, string name);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string xamlNamespace, string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The primary XAML namespace where this can exist.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying values for a name and a single XAML namespace. Use this signature only when you want or expect <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsUnknown%2A> to report for the directive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!IMPORTANT] > This signature of the constructor always generates an identifier for the directive where <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsUnknown%2A> reports `true` for the XAML type system. If the necessary information is available (the backing type and a text syntax information item for conversion) and you want an identifier that can apply the directive, use the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective.%23ctor%2A?displayProperty=fullName> constructor signature instead.
If you use this signature, the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective.AllowedLocation%2A> value for the instance is <xref:System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations>; and the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.Type%2A> value and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.TypeConverter%2A> value are both `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public XamlDirective (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> xamlNamespaces, string name, System.Xaml.XamlType xamlType, System.Xaml.Schema.XamlValueConverter<System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> typeConverter, System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations allowedLocation);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> xamlNamespaces, string name, class System.Xaml.XamlType xamlType, class System.Xaml.Schema.XamlValueConverter`1<class System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> typeConverter, valuetype System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations allowedLocation) cil managed

Docs.param: A set of XAML namespaces where this can exist, passed as an enumerable set of the identifier strings.
The XAML type that backs the .
The type converter that this uses for text syntax conversion.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying values for each per-case value of a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You must use this constructor to generate a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> that does not report <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsUnknown%2A> as `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations AllowedLocation { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations AllowedLocation

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies the XAML node types where the directive can be specified.
Docs.value: A value of the enumeration. The default is the enumeration default, which is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can set this value in the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective.%23ctor%28System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%7BSystem.String%7D%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Xaml.XamlType%2CSystem.Xaml.Schema.XamlValueConverter%7BSystem.ComponentModel.TypeConverter%7D%2CSystem.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations%29> constructor signature. If you construct by using the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> constructor signature, the AllowedLocation value for the instance is <xref:System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations>. However, the instance always reports <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsUnknown%2A> as `true`. This behavior typically affects attempts to write object graphs and also affects other practical uses of a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> value.
You typically would not construct a XAML directive case where AllowedLocation is <xref:System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Collections.Generic.IList<string> GetXamlNamespaces ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<string> GetXamlNamespaces() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a list of XAML namespaces where this XAML member can exist.
Docs.returns: A list of XAML namespace identifiers, as strings.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The XAML namespace identifiers are strings that typically appear in the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) string form according to the usual conventions for XAML and XML namespaces. If the list contains more than one item, the first item in the set is usually the relevant primary XAML namespace for processing purposes, and the other items are alternates. <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.PreferredXamlNamespace%2A?displayProperty=fullName> relies on this ordering.

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Reflection.ICustomAttributeProvider LookupCustomAttributeProvider() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an implementation. This implementation always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because a XAML directive cannot have custom attributes, this implementation always returns `null`. <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because a directive cannot have deferred loading, this implementation always returns `null`. <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.

Docs.summary: Returns a list of objects. The list reports the members where dependency relationships for initialization order exist relative to this . This implementation always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because a XAML directive cannot have initialization order, this implementation always returns `null`. <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override sealed System.Xaml.Schema.XamlMemberInvoker LookupInvoker ();
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Xaml.Schema.XamlMemberInvoker LookupInvoker() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the that is associated with a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method may be invoked by calls to <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.Invoker%2A>.
This implementation returns an internal static <xref:System.Xaml.Schema.XamlMemberInvoker> value that is specific to directives in the XAML type system. <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool LookupIsAmbient() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns whether this is reported as an ambient property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because a XAML directive cannot be an ambient type, this implementation always returns `false`. <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.

Docs.summary: Returns whether this represents an intended read-only property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By definition, directives are settable. <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override sealed bool LookupIsUnknown ();
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool LookupIsUnknown() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns whether this represents a member that is not resolvable by the backing system that is used for type and member resolution.
Docs.returns: if this represents a non-resolvable member; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> implementation only calls base and does nothing more. The base implementation returns the results in this order: the results are based on internal reflection; or the results are based on checking for a null value of the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.UnderlyingMember%2A>. The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> implementation seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.

Docs.summary: Returns the of the type where the can exist. This implementation always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Target types are not relevant for directives; therefore, this implementation always returns `null`. <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override sealed System.Xaml.XamlType LookupType ();
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Xaml.XamlType LookupType() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the of the type that is used by the member.
Docs.returns: The of the type that is used by the member.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> implementation only calls base and does nothing more. The base implementation returns results based either on internal reflection, or checking for a null value of <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.UnderlyingMember%2A>, processing in that order. <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
See Remarks in <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.LookupType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> for more information about what information <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.Type%2A> carries.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ToString ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of this .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If XAML namespace information is available, this implementation returns a string combination of <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.PreferredXamlNamespace%2A> and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.Name%2A>. If XAML namespace information is unavailable, this implementation returns <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.Name%2A>.
